algorithm_technique: Iterate through all possible masks for subsequences, check for palindromes, and find max product of disjoint ones.
problem_summary_simple: Find two disjoint palindromic subsequences in a string to maximize the product of their lengths.
problem_summary_technical: Uses bitmasks to represent subsequences, checks for palindromes, and iterates through submasks to find disjoint pairs for maximum product.
key_insights: Bitmasks are an efficient way to represent all possible subsequences.
The submask iteration technique (submask = (submask - 1) & inverse_mask) is crucial for exploring disjoint pairs.
Pre-calculating palindromic subsequence lengths for all masks optimizes the main loop.
